JobTitle: Global Employer Services Employment - Tax Manager
JobFullDesc: Are you a leader and strategic thinker who can integrate, deep tax technical expertise, strategic business knowledge and market-leading experience to advise on the design, delivery and taxation of employee compensation? Do you have an in-depth understanding of the regulatory landscape and business environments in which global clients operate around the world? If you said "Yes!" and this is your passion, we have the perfect career for you!The Employment Tax practice at Deloitte Tax LLP helps clients understand and manage the complexities of their US and global employment tax obligations - i.e. taxing and reporting compensation delivered to employees, executives, expatriates, non-employee directors, independent contractors, agency workers and more. We provide technical advice and strategic guidance to all types of organization - from public to private sector (listed and non-listed) and are privileged to serve some of the largest employers in the world.What you'll doAs a GES Employment Tax Senior Manager, you will:Support employment tax revenue growth in the US, and globally.Manage a broad range of client relationships, providing employment tax consultative services while exceeding expectations.Support employment tax due diligence, advisory, planning and compliance services.Identify engagement opportunities and coordinate with engagement leadership to deliver the breadth of Global Employer Services to the client.Develop, Market and/or sell new/existing services to current and target clients.Supervise the daily operations of your engagement teams and their delivery of compliance and consulting servicesEstablishing and maintain client relationships which may include the C-suite.Collaborate with client engagement leaders to address budgeting, billing, management, and engagement team deployment.Be responsible for the career development and motivation of your engagement teams.The TeamAs an Employment Tax Manager, you will be part of the Global Employer Services team. Our Global Employer Services tax consultants help clients develop tax-aligned compensation and benefits programs that address their international and domestic needs. Our consultants come from global mobility, compensation and benefits backgrounds and work with clients to streamline business operations while managing the scalability, risks, and costs of programs. Our team offers a full range of services and guides clients through their processes, technologies, and strategies.QualificationsRequiredBachelor's degree in accounting, human resources, international business, finance, economics, cross-cultural studies, or other liberal arts majors; ideally, with a related minor degree (for example, an accounting major and human resourcesminor)5+ years of experience in employment tax, global personal income tax compliance and consulting, global compensation rewards, transactions, mobility consulting, and/or global talent strategy consultingExperience in managing client relationshipsAt least one of the following accreditations:Licensed CPA in state of practice/primary officeLicensed attorneyEnrolled AgentTravel up to 25% (due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.PreferredMaster's degree or equivalent in the related fieldStrong technology skills including Excel, Microsoft PowerPointAble to work within large, complex engagements and work efficiently and with a sense of urgencyStrong analytical, consultative, quantitative, and project management skillsStrong executive presence, and excellent communication (verbal & written) and presentation skills with an aptitude for working as part of a global teamAbility to develop customized solutions to meet client needs with the ability to prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments, and manage assignments in a team environment
